column2: MO DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Missouri

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Hill area
column10: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 2. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 3. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You continue to yawn.
column6: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You donâ€™t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 4. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column4: be ready to stop.

column2: 5. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column8: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column10: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.

column2: 6. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.

column2: 7. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column8: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: swing to the right side of your lane.

column2: 8. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.
column10: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 9. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column4: the pedestrian

column2: 10. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 11. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column4: directly behind them.

column2: 12. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column6: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column8: you are on a four lane road.
column10: others drive below the speed limit.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: School zone ahead

column2: 14. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 15. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 16. If you fail the driving test three times:
column4: the Department will require additional behind-the-wheel driver training.
column6: you must send proof of the additional driver training before you will be allowed to take the driving test again.
column8: no further tests will be allowed without written authorization from the Department.

column2: 17. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column6: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column10: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 19. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 20. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: no passing zones.

column2: 21. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: go the wrong way.

column2: 22. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.

column2: 23. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column10: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
